business.headline: Reliance Power shares surge 8% today, 23% in last week. Should you buy?Reliance Power share price: Over the last six months, it has gone up by 59.92%. The stock has more than doubled in a year with a 141.40% rise. Over the last five years, the rise has been massive; 2,602.61%.

Living paycheck to paycheck: Analyst says India has worst family financial planningAn analyst said that in 2025 we need to teach kids not just how to earn money but how to manage it. He pointed out a common but dangerous mindset, the one with no room for budgeting, risk awareness, or financial learning.

RBI MPC: 25 bps rate cut on the cards? Here's all you need to knowSo far in 2025, the RBI has already cut the repo rate twice, once in February and then in April, by 25 bps each time. These cuts brought the key lending rate down to 6%.

NPS pensioners to get more benefits under Unified Pension Scheme. Details hereEligible NPS retirees can either get a one-time payment based on their last drawn Basic Pay and Dearness Allowance (DA) for every six months of service, or receive a monthly top-up if their current pension is less than what they'd get under UPS with Dearness Relief.

Leela Hotels share price: Stock lists at 7% discount on Dalal StreetThe company's stock opened at Rs 406 on the NSE, which is Rs 29 below the issue price of Rs 435. On the BSE, it opened slightly higher at Rs 406.50, still lower by Rs 28.50, or about 6.55%.

Sensex tumbles 700 points. Why is stock market falling despite strong GDP growth?The BSE Sensex was down 732.71 points to 80,718.30 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 197.45 points lower at 24,553.25. Most of the broader market indices also fell sharply amid a surge in volatility.

Leela Hotels vs Aegis Vopak listing: Which IPO will make stronger market debut?Leela Hotels and Aegis Vopak had their initial public offerings (IPOs) open for subscription from May 26 to May 28. While both IPOs were fully subscribed, they did not see very high demand during the bidding period.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, metal stocks drag market despite good GDP dataThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 723 points to 80,728.03, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 191 points to 24,559.95 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after GDP numbers?India's economy grew by 7.4% in the January-March quarter, surprising many analysts. The growth was mainly driven by strong activity in the construction and manufacturing sectors.

Stocks to watch on June 2: IndiGo, Nykaa, Leela Hotels, Tata Motors, BPCLStocks such as Apollo Hospitals, IndiGo, Tata Motors, BPCL, Leela Hotels, and Aegis Vopak Terminals are expected to be in the spotlight, driven by recent news updates and their fourth-quarter earnings announcements.

Pankaj Tripathi joins Hyundai Motor India as brand ambassadorPankaj Tripathi is known for his roles in films and web series where he often plays characters that are relatable and grounded. Hyundai said this quality made him the right choice to represent the brand.

Air India in talks for another mega aircraft deal with Airbus, Boeing: SourcesThe plane orders come at a time when aircraft manufacturers are scrambling with supply chain issues leading to severe delays in aircraft delivery and a looming jet shortage.

entertainment.headline: Good Boy's Park Bo-gum, Lee Sang-yi are ready for India, Bollywood'Good Boy' stars Park Bo-gum and Lee Sang-yi share their enthusiasm for India and Bollywood projects. Their visit could strengthen cultural ties and expand K-drama's influence in India.

Regular gaun ya naak se? Himesh Reshammiya's quirky request at Mumbai concertSinger Himesh Reshammiya stirred nostalgia with his performance on his hit track as a part of his Cap Mania Tour in Mumbai. During the concert, he playfully addressed his nasal singing style.

Actor Parambrata Chattopadhyay, wife Piya welcome baby boy: Our hearts are fullActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay and wife Piya Chakraborty have welcomed their first child, a baby boy, in Kolkata. Parambrata shared the good news with his fans on social media.

Aryan Khan enjoys a game of paddle tennis with friends. WatchShah Rukh Khan's son, Aryan, recently enjoyed a game of paddle tennis with friends in Mumbai. A video of him playing the friendly match has gone viral.

Rejections to winning Roadies XX, the underdog story of Gullu from Elvish's teamKushal Tanwar, aka Gullu, from Elvish Yadav's team won 'MTV Roadies XX (Double Cross)'. Here's a glimpse into his dramatic journey from facing rejections to finally gaining fame.

Pakistan army uses Kashmir to line their pockets, looting nation: Adnan SamiAdnan Sami spoke about Pakistan, its army and the people who are suffering because of the establishment. The singer shared that the army is exploiting the Kashmir issue in front of the world.

I'll work as long as I can: Clint Eastwood is not retiring even at 95At 95, Hollywood director Clint Eastwood says he has no plans to retire and is already working on his next film. He believes in continuous learning and creating original stories, rather than relying on remakes or sequels.

Akshay Kumar takes charge as Housefull 5 Pune event turns chaoticAkshay Kumar, along with the entire team of 'Housefull 5', got together at an event in Pune. Amid all the craze for the upcoming film, a video showed fans getting emotional after seeing their favourite stars.

Wednesday Season 2: Release date, plot, cast, and Lady Gaga's mysterious roleThe popular Netflix gothic series 'Wednesday' returns with Season 2. The show will be released in two parts starting August 6, 2025, with darker twists, new mysteries, and familiar faces. Pop star Lady Gaga joins as a mysterious Nevermore teacher in Part 2.

Jackie Chan was 40 when he learnt his father was a spy: My original name is FongActor Jackie Chan recently dropped a bombshell after he revealed that his father worked as a spy for the Chinese government. He learnt about his father's secret when he was 40.

Kamal Haasan's birthday note to Mani Ratnam is love letter to their cinematic dreamFrom 'Nayakan' to 'Thug Life', Kamal Haasan says he and Mani Ratnam share a common cinematic dream. The actor posted a heartfelt birthday tribute to the legendary director.

Tamil director Vikram Sugumaran dies of cardiac arrest at 47Director Vikram Sugumaran was reportedly on his way back from Madurai when he experienced severe chest pain and was rushed to the hospital. He is survived by his wife and children.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 10: Strong second Sunday for Rajkummar Rao's film'Bhool Chuk Maaf' wrapped up its second weekend on a good note. The Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi-starrer has got four days to enjoy a smooth run at the box office before 'Housefull 5' hits the screens.

Elvish Yadav's gang member Gullu wins MTV Roadies XX, takes home bike, Rs 10 lakh MTV Roadies XX: This was Elvish Yadav's first season as a gang member, and his team's Gullu won it for him. The contestant took a cash prize of Rs 10 lakh and a bike.

Assam's 9-year-old Binita Chetry bags third place on Britain's Got TalentAssam's Binita Chetry secured third position on 'Britain's Got Talent' 2025 final. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma congratulated the nine-year-old on her achievement on social media.

Comedian Gaurav Gupta's banter with Pak fan at US show: Chalo Hanuman chalisa padhoComedian Gaurav Gupta recently took a jibe at a Pakistani fan during a stand-up show as part of his US-Canada comedy tour, which led to mixed reactions.

Aamir Khan on unexpected romance with Gauri Spratt: We met by mistake and connectedActor Aamir Khan opened up on his bond with his partner Gauri Spratt. He recalled meeting her unexpectedly as he had not expected to find love again at this age.
Shah Rukh Khan's ripped and tattooed avatar leaves fans amazedShah Rukh Khan recently stunned fans with a new avatar, showcasing a muscular physique and flaunting his tattoos.

Bohot sharafat se... Actor Mumtaz recalls Yash Chopra's marriage proposalVeteran actor Mumtaz recalled once being proposed by the late filmmaker Yash Chopra. The 77-year-old spoke about her priorities at that time as an aspirational young actor.

general news.headline: Kamal Haasan moves Karnataka High Court for Thug Life's release amid Kannada rowActor Kamal Haasan has approached the Karnataka High Court to get his upcoming film Thug Life released in the state. The Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce (KFCC) banned the release of the film after protests erupted over his statement that Kannada originated from Tamil.

Russia's Pearl Harbour moment: 5 takeaways from Ukraine's stunning attackUkrainian special forces executed one of the largest and most complex drone-based special operations in modern warfare, destroying 41 Russian aircraft across multiple airbases using over 100 drones launched from disguised shipping containers.

On camera, Karnataka man hacked to death with machetes inside bakery; 7 arrestedKarnataka police have arrested seven individuals for the public murder of a 35-year-old man in Koppal district, allegedly over a long-standing property and family dispute.

Autistic brothers assaulted, burnt with cigarettes at Dehradun boarding schoolA mother in Dehradun has alleged that her two autistic sons were sexually assaulted, beaten, and tortured by a hostel caretaker at an illegal boarding school.

Father's health shapes a baby before it's even conceivedA growing body of research highlights the vital role of a father's health before conception in the baby's future. This shifts focus towards men's lifestyle and its lasting impact on pregnancy.

PM Modi unlikely to attend G7 Summit in Canada, first miss in 6 years: SourcesAmid frosty ties between Ottawa and New Delhi, PM Modi is unlikely to visit Canada for the upcoming G7 Summit. Neither has the Canadian side approached India regarding the visit, nor is the Indian side inclined to attend, said sources, adding that the relationship must improve before any such high-profile visit takes place.

I'm pregnant, was worried: Woman who hit auto driver with slippers apologisesA woman who attacked a Bengaluru autorickshaw driver with her slipper during an altercation publicly apologised on Sunday. She defended herself, saying she was afraid of having a miscarriage and expressed her love for the city and Kannada culture.

Gukesh reacts to epic win against Carlsen: 99 out of 100 times, I would loseD Gukesh and Magnus Carlsen showed contrasting reactions to their latest match in the Norway Chess. While Carlsen slammed the table and stormed off, Gukesh remained humble in perhaps the greatest win of his career.

There is too much trauma on TV and it is killing all the joyWatching any movie or TV series nowadays feels like a lesson in psychoanalysis, where all the motives, good or bad, must be explained by some sort of trauma, old or new. It makes watching TV joyless.

Bengaluru boys will win in Ahmedabad: DK Shivakumar backs RCB for big IPL finalKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar backed Royal Challengers Bengaluru to win IPL 2025, expressing joy over their finals entry and saying the state is united in hope as the side chases its long desired maiden title.

Comedian Gaurav Gupta's banter with Pak fan at US show: Chalo Hanuman chalisa padhoComedian Gaurav Gupta recently took a jibe at a Pakistani fan during a stand-up show as part of his US-Canada comedy tour, which led to mixed reactions.

Anna University sex assault accused gets 30 years in jail, fined Rs 90,000A special court in Chennai sentenced the accused in the Anna University sexual abuse case, Gnanasekaran, to 30 years of imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 90,000 after finding him guilty on all eleven charges.

Video: Shreyas Iyer's outburst against Shashank Singh after victory vs MumbaiPunjab Kings (PBKS) captain Shreyas Iyer was seen fuming at teammate Shashank Singh following his match-winning innings against Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

JEE Advanced 2025 result out, Rajit Gupta tops with 332 marks. Full list hereThe Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur has released the JEE Advanced 2025 results today, with Rajit Gupta from the IIT Delhi zone clinching the top spot. Candidates can now access their results at jeeadv.ac.in.

The irony. As Harvard graduate speaks about unity, a brawl in the backgroundIn a striking twist of irony, Yurong "Luanna" Jiang was speaking about empathy during her interview with The Associated Press when a scuffle broke out in the background.

117 drones, 18-month planning: Zelenskyy details 'brilliant op' deep into RussiaA day before the scheduled peace talks, Ukrainian forces launched one of their most daring and successful attacks on Russian soil, striking dozens of strategic bombers at airbases located thousands of kilometres behind the front lines.

Emotional Preity Zinta celebrates with Shreyas Iyer after PBKS reach IPL 2025 finalAn emotional Preity Zinta celebrated with PBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer as Punjab reached the final of IPL 2025 with a five-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Sunday, June 1. Punjab will face RCB in the final on June 3.

Karnataka releases Rs 7.65 crore to guarantee panel members, BJP calls it lootThe Karnataka government has released Rs 7.65 crore to Congress-appointed members of guarantee scheme committees. The Opposition called it a misuse of funds, while Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar defended the decision.

Arunachal man crosses raging river on rope bridge. Kiren Rijiju shares nail-biting videoA video of a man in Arunachal Pradesh crossing a raging river on a rope-hanging bridge has gone viral on social media.

How Indian tried to get US Green Card through marriage scam, got caughtA 29-year-old Indian pleaded guilty to marriage fraud and identity theft to secure a US Green Card. After overstaying his J-1 visa, Aakash Prakash Makwana paid $10,000 to marry a US citizen and falsified documents to support the fraudulent marriage. When the plan failed, he falsely claimed domestic abuse to remain in the US.

Baloch women now face brutality of Pakistani establishmentThe enforced disappearance of 24-year-old Mahjabeen Baloch last week marks an escalation. Baloch women are now being targeted by the Pakistani establishment in the same brutal way as Baloch men, children, and the elderly. There's a disturbing rise in enforced disappearances of women activists in Balochistan.

Unselfish Glenn Maxwell explains reason behind ODI retirementAustralia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell retired from the ODI format on Monday, June 2. Maxwell revealed that he did not want to hog his spot as Australia build up for the 2027 World Cup.

Case against Virat Kohli's pub in Bengaluru for lacking designated smoking zoneBengaluru's Cubbon Park Police has registered a suo-motu case against the restaurant for violating provisions of the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products Act (COTPA).

BJP's Dilip Ghosh skips Amit Shah's Bengal meet amid rift rumours: Wasn't invitedSenior BJP leader Dilip Ghosh was notably absent from the crucial organisational meeting attended by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, held ahead of the state elections.

sports.headline: French Open Day 9 Live Updates: Coco Gauff, Mirra Andreeva start proceedingsFrench Open Day 9 Live: The Day 9 of the Roland Garros 2025 will feature several big stars in action as Mirra Andreeva and Coco Gauff will start the proceedings in their respective women's singles match. Later in the day, Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner will be in action in men's.

Bengaluru boys will win in Ahmedabad: DK Shivakumar backs RCB for big IPL finalKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar backed Royal Challengers Bengaluru to win IPL 2025, expressing joy over their finals entry and saying the state is united in hope as the side chases its long desired maiden title.

Unselfish Glenn Maxwell explains reason behind ODI retirementAustralia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell retired from the ODI format on Monday, June 2. Maxwell revealed that he did not want to hog his spot as Australia build up for the 2027 World Cup.

Iyer interrupts Ponting in a moment of epic class: Not coach, a winning coachIPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer went viral on the internet after he gave an interview with Ricky Ponting on the Indian Premier League website. In a moment of class, Iyer stopped Ponting from calling himself just the 'coach' of Punjab Kings.

IPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer, Hardik Pandya fined for slow over rate in MI vs PBKSIPL 2025: Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer and Mumbai Indians skipper Hardik Pandya were fined after their teams were pulled up for slow over rates during a rain-affected Qualifier 2 in Ahmedabad.

Glenn Maxwell announces retirement from ODI cricket to shift focus to T20IsStar Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has announced his retirement from ODI cricket to shift his focus to T20Is, with the World Cup scheduled to be held in 2026. He retired with 149 appearances in the 50-over format, where he scored 3990 runs at an average of 33.81 with four hundreds and 23 fifties to his name.

What is Shreyas Iyer's biggest strength? ABD reacts to knock of IPL 2025Shreyas Iyer's played perhaps the knock of the Indian Premier League 2025 to storm his team into the final of the tournament. Sanjay Bangar and AB de Villiers were left awed by the batter's innings and spoke about his greatest strengths.

French Open Day 9: Djokovic, Sinner and Gauff eye quarter-finals berthThe Day 9 of the Roland Garros 2025 will feature several big stars in action as Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev and Coco Gauff, amongst others, will grace the court.

IPL 2025: Forged by fire, Shreyas Iyer blazes through the battle for recognitionIPL 2025 Qualifier 2: In a high-stakes chase against Mumbai Indians, Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer showed he's hungrier than ever. After months of doubt, snubs, and whispers about his game, he let his bat do the talking - reminding everyone he'd only been waiting for the right moment.

Rajeev Shukla set to become BCCI President as Roger Binny nears age limit: SourcesRajeev Shukla is set to take over as the BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) President as Roger Binny is nearing the age limit for holding the position as per the board's constitution.

Gukesh reacts to epic win against Carlsen: 99 out of 100 times, I would loseD Gukesh and Magnus Carlsen showed contrasting reactions to their latest match in the Norway Chess. While Carlsen slammed the table and stormed off, Gukesh remained humble in perhaps the greatest win of his career.

What is Shreyas Iyer's biggest strength? ABD reacts to knock of IPL 2025Shreyas Iyer's played perhaps the knock of the Indian Premier League 2025 to storm his team into the final of the tournament. Sanjay Bangar and AB de Villiers were left awed by the batter's innings and spoke about his greatest strengths.

French Open Day 9: Djokovic, Sinner and Gauff eye quarter-finals berthThe Day 9 of the Roland Garros 2025 will feature several big stars in action as Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev and Coco Gauff, amongst others, will grace the court.

IPL 2025: Forged by fire, Shreyas Iyer blazes through the battle for recognitionIPL 2025 Qualifier 2: In a high-stakes chase against Mumbai Indians, Punjab Kings captain Shreyas Iyer showed he's hungrier than ever. After months of doubt, snubs, and whispers about his game, he let his bat do the talking - reminding everyone he'd only been waiting for the right moment.

Rajeev Shukla set to become BCCI President as Roger Binny nears age limit: SourcesRajeev Shukla is set to take over as the BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) President as Roger Binny is nearing the age limit for holding the position as per the board's constitution.

Gukesh reacts to epic win against Carlsen: 99 out of 100 times, I would loseD Gukesh and Magnus Carlsen showed contrasting reactions to their latest match in the Norway Chess. While Carlsen slammed the table and stormed off, Gukesh remained humble in perhaps the greatest win of his career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
